intro: Tontanea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy tontanea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruits are oval-shaped, green when immature, and turn yellow or orange when mature. Tontanea hirsuta is often grown for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
